name: Petit Palace Ducal Hotel

reviews.title: Good facilities and 'particular' bathroom door
reviews.text: We had a nice and spacious corner-room on the 6th floor with a view over Calle Hortaleza.We were amazed when we found out that in our room there was a computer with a free broadband connection.The bathroom door revealed to be hilarious at best. It was a see-through glass door, so there was no privacy at all on that account. It was sort of funny for us but I imagine it could get a bit uncomfortable for somebody else.I've to admit that the staff didn't impress me that much except one guy, that was kind and professional.The hotel is in a good position to reach almost every place and considering everything, it was a very good value for money.

reviews.title: I loved the hotel
reviews.text: This is a small botique hotel that is within walking distance to many of the tourist sights of Madrid. The staff was very friendly and helpful and they had very good knowledge of the area.

reviews.title: fabulous for shopping
reviews.text: Irish mother with two teenage daughters loved the hotel, the staff and the location. We stayed end of January and all the shops had their sales on. Lots of shoe shops and trendy boutiques outside your door.

reviews.title: Amazingly Central - but prepare for noise!
reviews.text: Hotel within walking distance of Puerto del Sol, also located right beside the Metro Grand Via station and all main attractions are easily accessible. Staff very helpful and rooms clean and modern.

Visited mid jan for 4 days, paid £200 for 4 nights. Room on the first floor, very clean, tidy, very modern - amazing multi-jet shower! Staff all helpful and friendly. Hotel is located as centrally as is possible, which is brilliant, everywhere is accesible by foot or metro.
reviews.title: Central Location but be aware...

reviews.text: only problem was the noise from the main rd (Gran Via) and the Horteleza - a very popular street at night. Drivers and emergency services aren't afraid to use their sirens/horns at 2am! i excpect that with the need to ventilate the room during the summer, opening the windows and sleeping wouldn't be ideal.
reviews.title: Not a bad place to stay
Never again.......
reviews.text: good short stay, on a budget hotel!

reviews.title: Fantastic location, central AND quiet
reviews.text: Great location. Right in the middle of the trendy neighborhood Chueca, which is full of cute shops, great restaurants and bars, and happening gay nightlife. However, our room, which faced the street but was on the 6th floor, was very quiet! We also had a balcony which was fabulous. The room was modest, but clean, and the free internet was a bonus (although it would be nice if the room with the computers was air conditioned, too). The AC in the rooms is controlled individually and you can leave it on when you leave, which makes for a blissfully cool return in August! Recommend hotel for sure.

reviews.title: nothing to complain about
reviews.text: this hotel is absolutly beautiful. the breakfast is good (fruit, toast, meat, cheese, english breakfast). the location is perfect! you could not wish for a better location. the rooms are neat and will be cleaned everyday. the staff speaks poor english (but almost everyone in madrid does). the airconditioning was working, you can change the temperature yourself. would definatly stay here again.

The hotel is in a great location... right off of the metro (Gran Via exit) and close to EVERYTHING (go to the Plaza Mayor). I travelled with two friends and shared a triple room. The room was a bit small, BUT realize that we are Americans, so everything in Europe is small compared to what we're used to. The bathroom is as everyone mentioned... one wall of frosted glass with a squre filigree cut out that let's you see the person sitting down... if you catch my drift. It was conventional and worked for three ladies that had way TOO MUCH luggage. Noise was a factor in the beginning but after 10 days in Spain we realized that it's pretty much the same anywhere you stay (walls are thin). It wasn't terrible but we did hear party people coming in at 5am. We did the same thing to our neighbors the following night so, what can you do but say "Es lo que es" (it is what it is). We stayed there our first night in Madrid and went on to do a tour throughout Andalucia. Petit Palace Ducal was pretty inexpensive, compared to the other hotels. You do have to pay for breakfast, I recommend going somewhere else for breakfast if you have the time... if you don't have the time, go for it... just know it is a bit pricey but decent. Very different for Americans, you have to remember you're in another country, be careful with the coffee machine... it's like espresso... didn't drink the coffee, went down the street to Starbucks. There are pubs, restaurants, bars (Cervecias), shops all around. No need to worry about needing transportation. We actually used the metro to get to our hotel from the Airport (Barajas), the maps are straight forward and we got there easily (navigation wise), lugging our 60lb luggaage was a different story. My point is, use the metro. It is less expensive, pretty easy to use and takes you pretty much all over. The staff is as helpful as they can be BUT their English was like my Spanish... which wasn't very good. But between my bad Spanish and their bad English... it worked itself out. All in all it was great for the money. Bring your walking shoes and get ready for some Vino!!!
reviews.title: Perfect Location!

reviews.text: I travelled with two other girls, and Madrid was our first stop. Wow, were we impressed by this hotel! The only thing that threw us off a little bit is the bathroom door (whoever has stayed there will get what I mean!), but the breakfast was amazing, internet access was free, it was close to transport, food, sights, banks, everything! The staff was very friendly and helpful as well. It was a really great start to our trip and as we kept on travelling through Europe we only wished other hotels were like that.
